content: On July 9, 1994, the Atlanta Braves faced the New York Mets in a pivotal game that showcased the brilliance of pitcher Greg Maddux. Maddux delivered a masterful performance, throwing a complete game and allowing just one run while striking out seven batters. This game was part of a remarkable season for Maddux, who would go on to win his fourth consecutive Cy Young Award that year, solidifying his status as one of the greatest pitchers in baseball history.
